'''Florence Rose Pugh''' ({{IPAc-en|p|j|uː}} {{respell|PEW}}; born 3 January 1996) is an English actress. She made her acting debut in 2014 in the drama film ''[[The Falling (2014 film)|The Falling]]''. Pugh gained recognition in 2016 for her leading role as a young bride in the independent drama ''[[Lady Macbeth (film)|Lady Macbeth]]'', winning a [[British Independent Film Award]], and drew praise for starring in the miniseries ''[[The Little Drummer Girl (TV series)|The Little Drummer Girl]]'' (2018).

Pugh's international breakthrough came in 2019 with her portrayals of professional wrestler [[Paige (wrestler)|Paige]] in the biographical sports film ''[[Fighting with My Family]]'', a despondent American woman in the horror film ''[[Midsommar]]'', and [[Amy March]] in the period drama ''[[Little Women (2019 film)|Little Women]]''. For the last of these, she received nominations for an [[Academy Award]] and a [[BAFTA Award]]. Pugh was awarded the [[Trophée Chopard]] at the [[2019 Cannes Film Festival]]. 

She has played [[Black Widow (Yelena Belova)|Yelena Belova]] in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]], beginning with ''[[Black Widow (2021 film)|Black Widow]]'' (2021). The next year, she starred in the thriller ''[[Don't Worry Darling]]'' and drama ''[[The Wonder (film)|The Wonder]]'', and voiced [[Goldilocks]] in the animated film ''[[Puss in Boots: The Last Wish]]''. Pugh also portrayed [[Jean Tatlock]] in [[Christopher Nolan]]'s biographical film ''[[Oppenheimer (film)|Oppenheimer]]'' (2023), her highest-grossing release.<!-- Do not add ''Thunderbolts'' or any other unreleased films to the lead -->

==Early life==
Florence Rose Pugh<ref>{{Cite web |title=Florence Pugh |url=https://www.biography.com/actors/florence-pugh#:~:text=Florence%20Rose%20Pugh%20was%20born,her%20mother%20a%20dance%20teacher. |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230929000539/https://www.biography.com/actors/florence-pugh |archive-date=September 29, 2023 |access-date=September 28, 2023 |website=[[Biography (TV program)|Biography]]}}</ref> was born on 3 January 1996 in [[Oxford]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/celebrity-birthdays-week-jan-74933528|title=Celebrity birthdays for the week of Jan. 3–9|publisher=[[ABC News]]|date=28 December 2020|access-date=26 May 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210102052724/https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/celebrity-birthdays-week-jan-74933528|archive-date=2 January 2021|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="marcella">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-37274640|title=Lady Macbeth: Florence Pugh on her killer first lead role|last=Masters|first=Tim|publisher=[[BBC News]]|date=28 April 2017|access-date=16 August 2022|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220626034128/https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-37274640|archive-date=26 June 2022}}</ref> to dancer Deborah and [[restaurateur]] Clinton Pugh.<ref name=OxfordTimes>{{cite web|last1=MacAlister|first1=Katherine|title=Florence Pugh goes straight from A-levels to LA|url=http://www.oxfordtimes.co.uk/leisure/focus/12909725.Florence_Pugh_goes_straight_from_A_levels_to_LA/|work=[[The Oxford Times]]|access-date=26 December 2015|date=23 April 2015|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151227152431/http://www.oxfordtimes.co.uk/leisure/focus/12909725.Florence_Pugh_goes_straight_from_A_levels_to_LA/|archive-date=27 December 2015}}</ref><ref name=Inews201704>{{cite news|url=https://inews.co.uk/essentials/florence-pugh-dying-not-bad/|work=[[i (newspaper)|i]]|date=27 April 2017|last=Aftab|first=Kaleem|title=Florence Pugh: 'Dying was not that bad'|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170917171141/https://inews.co.uk/essentials/florence-pugh-dying-not-bad/|archive-date=17 September 2017}}</ref> She has three siblings: actor and musician [[Toby Sebastian]], actress Arabella Gibbins, and Rafaela "Raffie" Pugh.<ref name="Vogue202001">{{cite web |last=Wood |first=Gaby |date=9 January 2020 |title=From Little Women to Marvel Superhero, Florence Pugh Is a New Kind of Breakout Star |url=https://www.vogue.com/article/florence-pugh-cover-february-2020 |newspaper=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]] |access-date=2 February 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200219231619/https://www.vogue.com/article/florence-pugh-cover-february-2020 |archive-date=19 February 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref> She suffered from [[tracheomalacia]] as a child, which led to frequent hospitalisations. The family relocated to [[Manilva]] in Spain when Pugh was three years old, hoping the warmer weather would improve her health. They lived there until she was six, when they moved back to Oxford.<ref name="Vogue202001"/><ref name=Elle202001>{{cite magazine |last=Alameda |first=Marta |date=20 January 2020 |title=Florence Pugh es la actriz del momento tras su nominación a un Oscar por 'Mujercitas' |url=https://www.elle.com/es/star-style/noticias-famosos/a30528725/florence-pugh-oscar-mujercitas-peliculas-instagram-youtube/ |magazine=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]] |access-date=2 February 2020 |language=es |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200202182529/https://www.elle.com/es/star-style/noticias-famosos/a30528725/florence-pugh-oscar-mujercitas-peliculas-instagram-youtube/ |archive-date=2 February 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref> 

At six years old, Pugh played [[Mary, mother of Jesus|Mary]] in a school [[nativity play]], for which she spoke in a [[Yorkshire dialect|Yorkshire accent]].<ref name="Grdn201810">{{cite news |last1=Hayes |first1=Martha |title=Florence Pugh: 'You never see an unplucked brow in Hollywood' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/fashion/tvandradioblog/2018/oct/06/florence-pugh-lady-macbeth-king-lear-le-carre |access-date=21 October 2018 |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=6 October 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181020221431/https://www.theguardian.com/fashion/tvandradioblog/2018/oct/06/florence-pugh-lady-macbeth-king-lear-le-carre |archive-date=20 October 2018 |url-status=live }}</ref> She was privately educated at [[Wychwood School]] and [[St Edward's School, Oxford]], but disliked how the schools did not support her acting ambitions.<ref name="Grdn201810"/>

==Career==
===Early roles (2014–2018)===
[[File:Florence Pugh at the 58th BFI London Film Festival Awards (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Pugh at the 2014 [[BFI London Film Festival]]]]
While still studying in [[sixth form]], Pugh made her professional acting debut in the 2014 drama ''[[The Falling (2014 film)|The Falling]]'', playing a precocious teenager opposite [[Maisie Williams]].<ref name="Grdn201810"/><ref>{{cite news|last1=Orr|first1=Gillian|title='After you left the room I said, Wow!': director Carol Morley and actress Florence Pugh on their haunting new film The Falling|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/after-you-left-the-room-i-said-wow-director-carol-morley-and-actress-florence-pugh-on-their-haunting-10182952.html|work=[[The Independent]]|access-date=26 December 2015|date=18 April 2015|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151219042448/http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/after-you-left-the-room-i-said-wow-director-carol-morley-and-actress-florence-pugh-on-their-haunting-10182952.html|archive-date=19 December 2015}}</ref> Tara Brady of ''[[The Irish Times]]'' deemed Pugh "remarkable", while [[IndieWire]]'s Oliver Lyttelton called her "striking".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.irishtimes.com/culture/film/the-falling-review-combining-kitchen-sink-grit-and-otherworldly-mystery-1.2186468|title=The Falling review: combining kitchen-sink grit and otherworldly mystery|newspaper=[[The Irish Times]]|first=Tara|last=Brady|date=23 April 2015|access-date=7 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151219011554/http://www.irishtimes.com/culture/film/the-falling-review-combining-kitchen-sink-grit-and-otherworldly-mystery-1.2186468|archive-date=19 December 2015|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Lyttelton|first1=Oliver|url=https://www.indiewire.com/2015/08/review-unsettling-and-uneven-the-falling-starring-maisie-williams-261026/|title=Review: Unsettling And Uneven 'The Falling' Starring Maisie Williams|publisher=[[IndieWire]]|date=7 August 2015|access-date=9 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210330161828/https://www.indiewire.com/2015/08/review-unsettling-and-uneven-the-falling-starring-maisie-williams-261026/|archive-date=30 March 2021|url-status=live}}</ref> In the same year, Pugh was nominated for Best British Newcomer at the [[BFI London Film Festival]] as well as for Young British / Irish Performer of the Year by the [[London Film Critics' Circle]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Muir|first1=Kate|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/the-falling-at-the-london-film-festival-9bsz6sswnrw|title=The Falling at the London Film Festival|work=[[The Times]]|url-access=subscription|quote=Lydia's best friend for ever ... is Abbie, played by Florence Pugh, who was nominated for best newcomer at the festival.|date=11 October 2014|access-date=9 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210509101224/https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/the-falling-at-the-london-film-festival-9bsz6sswnrw|archive-date=9 May 2021|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Lodge|first1=Guy|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/awards/carol-45-years-and-tom-hardy-lead-london-critics-nominations-1201661539/|title='Carol,' '45 Years' Come Out On Top In London Critics' Award Nods|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=15 December 2015|access-date=9 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210422094112/https://variety.com/2015/film/awards/carol-45-years-and-tom-hardy-lead-london-critics-nominations-1201661539/|archive-date=22 April 2021|url-status=live}}</ref> The next year, she was cast as a singer-songwriter in the [[dramedy]] pilot ''Studio City'', co-starring [[Eric McCormack]] as the character's father.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/tv/news/studio-city-fox-cast-florence-pugh-eric-mccormack-daughter-1201447167/|title=British Newcomer Florence Pugh Cast as Eric McCormack's Daughter in 'Studio City'|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|first=Elizabeth|last=Wagmeister|date=5 March 2015|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180114020504/https://variety.com/2015/tv/news/studio-city-fox-cast-florence-pugh-eric-mccormack-daughter-1201447167/|archive-date=14 January 2018}}</ref> The pilot was not picked up to series.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Lord|first1=Annie|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/florence-pugh-little-women-oscars-2020-ceremony-winners-instagram-a9319746.html|title=Florence Pugh: The movie star who makes 'relatable' look easy|work=[[The Independent]]|date=7 February 2020|access-date=9 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200819181130/https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/florence-pugh-little-women-oscars-2020-ceremony-winners-instagram-a9319746.html|archive-date=19 August 2020|url-status=live}}</ref> Pugh later characterised her experience on ''Studio City'' negatively due to pressures to change her appearance.<ref name=Variety221101>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2022/film/news/florence-pugh-body-shamed-studio-execs-change-face-1235419750/|title=Florence Pugh Felt Acting Was a 'Massive Mistake' After Execs Criticized Her Body at 19: They Tried to Change the 'Shape of My Face'|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|first=Zach|last=Sharf|date=1 November 2022|access-date=1 November 2022|archive-date=1 November 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221101193450/https://variety.com/2022/film/news/florence-pugh-body-shamed-studio-execs-change-face-1235419750/|url-status=live}}</ref>

In 2016, Pugh starred in the independent drama ''[[Lady Macbeth (film)|Lady Macbeth]]'', a film based on [[Nikolai Leskov]]'s novella ''[[Lady Macbeth of the Mtsensk District (novella)|Lady Macbeth of the Mtsensk District]]'', and appeared in the first series of the [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] detective series ''[[Marcella (TV series)|Marcella]]''.<ref name="marcella"/> In the former, she played Katherine, an unhappily married bride who grows violent. Pugh attributed her attraction to the part to her partiality to characters with "confusing or at least interesting" motivations.<ref name="ladym">{{cite web|last1=Thorpe|first1=Vanessa|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/apr/22/florence-page-rising-star-lady-macbeth-film|title=No link to the Bard … but this Lady Macbeth is just as deadly|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=22 April 2017|access-date=9 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201231071118/https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/apr/22/florence-page-rising-star-lady-macbeth-film|archive-date=31 December 2020|url-status=live}}</ref> The role earned her acclaim.<ref name="ladym"/> She also credited the production with reviving her interest in cinema after being dispirited by ''Studio City''.<ref name=Variety221101/> Reviewing the film for ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'', Guy Lodge commended her portrayal of the character's "complex, under-the-skin transformation".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/reviews/lady-macbeth-review-1201853847/|title=Film Review: 'Lady Macbeth'|last1=Lodge|first1=Guy|date=9 September 2016|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|access-date=21 July 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170710055050/http://variety.com/2016/film/reviews/lady-macbeth-review-1201853847/|archive-date=10 July 2017}}</ref> She won the [[BIFA Award for Best Performance by an Actress in a British Independent Film]] for the role.<ref name="BIFA">{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/gods-own-country-bifa-1202635435/|title='God's Own Country' Wins Big at British Independent Film Awards|last1=Clarke|first1=Stewart|date=10 December 2017|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|access-date=6 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180811232130/https://variety.com/2017/film/news/gods-own-country-bifa-1202635435/|archive-date=11 August 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>

In 2018, Pugh was nominated for the [[BAFTA Rising Star Award]] at the [[71st British Academy Film Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/2de1aefcc9e34251b340ebd27ba8ac90|title=Pugh and O'Connor: BAFTA Rising Stars|publisher=[[Associated Press]]|date=4 January 2018|access-date=9 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210509080952/https://apnews.com/article/2de1aefcc9e34251b340ebd27ba8ac90|archive-date=9 May 2021|url-status=live}}</ref> She then played [[Cordelia (King Lear)|Cordelia]] to [[Anthony Hopkins]]'s titular [[King Lear]] in [[Richard Eyre]]'s television film ''[[King Lear (2018 film)|King Lear]]'' and appeared in the short film ''[[Leading Lady Parts]]'' in support of the [[Time's Up (organization)|Time's Up]] initiative.<ref name="Grdn201810"/><ref name="leading">{{Cite web|last1=Zemler|first1=Emily|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-gemma-arterton-leading-lady-parts-20180802-story.html|title=Gemma Arterton's Time's Up-inspired short 'Leading Lady Parts' takes aim at the casting process|date=2 August 2018|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|url-access=limited|access-date=13 April 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191230171034/https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-gemma-arterton-leading-lady-parts-20180802-story.html|archive-date=30 December 2019|url-status=live}}</ref> Later that year, Pugh portrayed [[Elizabeth de Burgh]] in the [[Netflix]] historical film ''[[Outlaw King]]'', co-starring [[Chris Pine]] as [[Robert the Bruce]]. Charles Bramesco of ''[[The Guardian]]'' found her to be "excellent despite her thankless role".<ref name="outlaw">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2018/sep/07/outlaw-king-review-chris-pine|title=Outlaw King review – Chris Pine fronts up for some macho medieval bombast|work=[[The Guardian]]|first=Charles|last=Bramesco|date=7 September 2018|access-date=7 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180907111009/https://www.theguardian.com/film/2018/sep/07/outlaw-king-review-chris-pine|archive-date=7 September 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> She next starred in a [[The Little Drummer Girl (miniseries)|six-part miniseries]] adaptation of [[John le Carré]]'s spy novel ''[[The Little Drummer Girl]]'', in which she played an actress who becomes embroiled in an espionage plot.<ref>{{cite news |title=Meet the cast of The Little Drummer Girl |url=https://www.radiotimes.com/news/tv/2018-11-02/the-little-drummer-girl-bbc-cast-florence-pugh-alexander-skarsgard-michael-shannon/ |work=[[Radio Times]] |access-date=7 March 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181106005026/https://www.radiotimes.com/news/tv/2018-11-02/the-little-drummer-girl-bbc-cast-florence-pugh-alexander-skarsgard-michael-shannon/ |archive-date=6 November 2018 |url-status=live }}</ref> Her performance was met with praise.<ref name="drummer">{{cite web|last1=O'Connor|first1=Roisin|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/news/little-drummer-girl-reviews-round-new-bbc-drama-florence-pugh-alexander-skarsgard-a8606191.html|title=Little Drummer Girl reviews round-up: What the critics are saying about new BBC drama starring Florence Pugh|work=[[The Independent]]|date=29 October 2018|access-date=9 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201129154243/https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/news/little-drummer-girl-reviews-round-new-bbc-drama-florence-pugh-alexander-skarsgard-a8606191.html|archive-date=29 November 2020|url-status=live}}</ref> While divided on the series overall, [[Richard Lawson (writer)|Richard Lawson]] of ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'' called Pugh "terrific throughout" and added that she "smartly mixes earthiness with sophistication, wisdom with naïveté."<ref>{{cite news |author=Lawson, Richard |title=Florence Pugh Proves Herself a Star in The Little Drummer Girl |url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2018/11/the-little-drummer-girl-review-florence-pugh-park-chan-wook |access-date=22 January 2019 |work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]] |url-access=limited |date=13 November 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190626222957/https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2018/11/the-little-drummer-girl-review-florence-pugh-park-chan-wook |archive-date=26 June 2019 |url-status=live }}</ref>

===Breakthrough and critical recognition (2019–present)===
Pugh starred in three major films in 2019, during which she was recognised as having experienced an international breakthrough.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/entertainment-florence-pugh-ap-breakthrough-entertainers-ap-top-news-d09bc4281d1a7fcfc4012f911a639586|title=2019 Breakthrough Entertainer: Florence Pugh owns the year|last=Myers|first=Amanda Lee|date=16 December 2019|publisher=[[Associated Press]]|access-date=7 July 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210707172706/https://apnews.com/article/entertainment-florence-pugh-ap-breakthrough-entertainers-ap-top-news-d09bc4281d1a7fcfc4012f911a639586|archive-date=7 July 2021|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2019/12/florence-pugh-little-women-black-widow-midsommar-fighting-with-my-family-interview-1202799412/|title=How To Hit A Grand Slam: Florence Pugh On Her Banner Roll 'Fighting With My Family', 'Midsommar', 'Little Women' & 'Black Widow'|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|first=Anthony|last=D'Alessandro|date=5 December 2019|access-date=10 December 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191206125136/https://deadline.com/2019/12/florence-pugh-little-women-black-widow-midsommar-fighting-with-my-family-interview-1202799412/|archive-date=6 December 2019|url-status=live}}</ref> She first played professional wrestler [[Paige (wrestler)|Paige]] in ''[[Fighting with My Family]]'', a comedy-drama about Paige's career. The film premiered at the [[2019 Sundance Film Festival]] to positive reviews.<ref name="family">{{cite web|last1=Brueggemann|first1=Tom|url=https://www.indiewire.com/2019/02/fighting-with-my-family-sundance-specialty-box-office-1202044692/|title='Fighting With My Family' Breaks Out of Sundance at Specialty Box Office|publisher=[[IndieWire]]|quote=Positive reviews helped, but even in these more sophisticated locations this found an initial strong response.|date=17 February 2019|access-date=6 July 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190218125323/https://www.indiewire.com/2019/02/fighting-with-my-family-sundance-specialty-box-office-1202044692/|archive-date=18 February 2019|url-status=live}}</ref> Geoffrey Macnab of ''[[The Independent]]'' called Pugh "completely convincing as the wrestler", adding that she showed "the same defiance, scruffy glamour and self-deprecating humour as the real life ... Paige".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Macnab |first1=Geoffrey |title=Fighting with My Family review: Far more gripping than its subject matter might suggest |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/reviews/fighting-with-my-family-review-film-movie-wwe-stephen-merchant-florence-pugh-wrestling-a8800111.html |access-date=7 March 2019 |work=[[The Independent]] |date=1 March 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190303235132/https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/reviews/fighting-with-my-family-review-film-movie-wwe-stephen-merchant-florence-pugh-wrestling-a8800111.html |archive-date=3 March 2019 |url-status=live }}</ref> Pugh next headlined [[Ari Aster]]'s horror film ''[[Midsommar]]'', which chronicles an American couple, played by her and [[Jack Reynor]], who travel to Sweden and encounter a cult.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Olsen|first1=Mark|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-midsommar-spoilers-ari-aster-jack-reynor-20190703-story.html|title='Midsommar' explained: The filmmakers unpack the sex, rituals and shocking ending|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|url-access=limited|date=3 July 2019|access-date=15 July 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210126231136/https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-midsommar-spoilers-ari-aster-jack-reynor-20190703-story.html|archive-date=26 January 2021|url-status=live}}</ref> Critics complimented Pugh's portrayal of the desolate Dani Ardor, with [[David Edelstein]] of ''[[Vulture (magazine)|Vulture]]'' calling it "amazingly vivid".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Campbell|first1=Christopher|url=https://editorial.rottentomatoes.com/article/midsommar-first-reviews-florence-pugh-goes-full-toni-collette-in-ari-asters-gory-surreal-divisive-second-film/|title=Midsommar First Reviews: Florence Pugh Goes Full Toni Collette in Ari Aster's Gory, Surreal, Divisive Second Film|publisher=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|date=19 June 2019|access-date=15 July In her final film release of the year, Pugh starred in ''[[Little Women (2019 film)|Little Women]]'', a [[period drama]] film adaptation of [[Louisa May Alcott]]'s [[Little Women|novel of the same name]] directed by [[Greta Gerwig]]. She portrayed [[Amy March]], a fickle artist, from age 12 into adulthood, and has said that the character is in a "sweet spot of not knowing how to deal with her emotions".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Erbland|first1=Kate|url=https://www.indiewire.com/2019/12/little-women-florence-pugh-amy-interview-1202198108/|title='Little Women': Florence Pugh Turned the Brat Into the Film's Breakout Commenting on the reception, she defended her choice and her body on Instagram.<ref>{{cite news |last=Friedman |first=Vanessa |date=26 April 2023 |title=Florence Pugh on Her First Met Gala and the Truth About Brand Ambassadorships |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/26/style/florence-pugh-pierpaolo-piccioli-met-gala.html |access-date=2 May 2023 |work=The New York Times |archive-date=2 May 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230502025051/https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/26/style/florence-pugh-pierpaolo-piccioli-met-gala.html |url-status=live }}</ref> A year later, she wore another transparent gown to a Valentino event.<ref>{{cite news |last=Twersky |first=Carolyn |date=6 July 2023 |title=Florence Pugh Wore Yet Another Completely Sheer Gown to the Valentino Couture Show |url=https://www.wmagazine.com/fashion/florence-pugh-sheer-gown-nipples-valentino-couture-show |access-date=6 July 2023 |work=W |archive-date=5 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230705195043/https://www.wmagazine.com/fashion/florence-pugh-sheer-gown-nipples-valentino-couture-show |url-status=live }}</ref>

30, in 2019.<ref>{{cite web |last=Blair |first=Olivia |date=12 February 2019 |title=Lily James, Jodie Comer and Letitia Wright named among the most game-changing under 30-year-olds in Europe |url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/uk/celebrities/news/a26301510/30-under-30-forbes-list/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190412132628/https://www.harpersbazaar.com/uk/celebrities/news/a26301510/30-under-30-forbes-list/ |archive-date=12 April 2019 |access-date=6 January 2020 |work=[[Harper's Bazaar]]}}</ref> ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine placed her on the artists category of its [[Time 100 Next|100 Next]] list, which highlights rising stars and emerging leaders in their fields, in 2021.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Headey |first1=Lena |author-link=Lena Headey |date=17 February 2021 |title=2021 Time100 Next: Florence Pugh |url=https://time.com/collection/time100-next-2021/5937673/florence-pugh/ |url-status=live |magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210217134109/https://time.com/collection/time100-next-2021/5937673/florence-pugh/ |archive-date=17 February 2021 |access-date=12 June 2021 |url-access=limited}}</ref> In 2023, the magazine featured her in their [[Time 100#Next Generation Leaders|Next Generation Leaders]] list.<ref name="time23">{{cite magazine |last1=Dockterman |first1=Eliana |date=23 May 2023 |title=Florence Pugh Might Just Save the Movie Star From Extinction |url=https://time.com/collection/next-generation-leaders/6278537/florence-pugh-leaders/ |magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |access-date=24 May 2023 |url-access=limited |archive-date=24 May 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230524042818/https://time.com/collection/next-generation-leaders/6278537/florence-pugh-leaders/ |url-status=live }}</ref> In a 2022 readers' poll by ''[[Empire (magazine)|Empire]]'' magazine, she was voted one of the 50 greatest actors of all time.<ref name="empirepoll">{{cite news|first1=Ben|last1=Travis|first2=Sophie|last2=Butcher|first3=Nick|last3=De Semlyen|first4=James|last4=Dyer|first5=John|last5=Nugent|first6=Alex|last6=Godfrey|first7=Helen|last7=O'Hara|title=Empire's 50 Greatest Actors of All Time List, Revealed|url=https://www.empireonline.com/movies/features/best-actors/|magazine=[[Empire (magazine)|Empire]]|date=20 December 2022|access-date=4 February 2023|archive-date=29 December 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221229101239/https://www.empireonline.com/movies/features/best-actors|url-status=live}}</ref> Terming her "one of the very best of her generation", the magazine attributed her success to bringing "a grounded empathy to her characters".<ref name="empirepoll"/>

==Personal life and other work==
From 2019 to 2022, Pugh was in a relationship with American actor and filmmaker [[Zach Braff]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cuttler |first=Andrea |date=16 August 2022 |title=Florence Pugh Is Just Being Honest |url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/culture/film-tv/a40772062/florence-pugh-dont-worry-darling-interview/ |access-date=16 August 2022 |website=[[Harper's Bazaar]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220816144454/https://www.harpersbazaar.com/culture/film-tv/a40772062/florence-pugh-dont-worry-darling-interview/|archive-date=16 August 2022|url-status=live}}</ref> They met while working together on the short film ''In the Time It Takes to Get There'',<ref>{{cite magazine|last1=Kirkpatrick|first1=Emily|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/style/2022/01/zach-braff-florence-pugh-26-birthday-tribute-instagram-relationship|title=Zach Braff Says He's "So Lucky to Know" Florence Pugh in 26th Birthday Tribute|magazine=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|url-access=limited|date=4 January 2022|access-date=26 May 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220105081627/https://www.vanityfair.com/style/2022/01/zach-braff-florence-pugh-26-birthday-tribute-instagram-relationship|archive-date=5 January 2022|url-status=live}}</ref> which Braff directed,<ref name="inthetime">{{cite web|last1=Morin|first1=Alyssa|date=3 April 2019|title=See Zach Braff's Comical Take on Social Media Influencers in New Short Film|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1028841/see-zach-braff-s-comical-take-on-social-media-influencers-in-new-short-film|access-date=15 July 2020|publisher=[[E!]]|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190508084057/https://www.eonline.com/news/1028841/see-zach-braff-s-comical-take-on-social-media-influencers-in-new-short-film|archive-date=8 May 2019}}</ref> and lived together in Los Angeles.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Fernandez|first1=Alexia|url=https://people.com/movies/florence-pugh-zach-braff-relationship-timeline/|title=A Timeline of Florence Pugh and Zach Braff's Relationship: From Just Friends to Defending Their Love|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=9 April 2020|access-date=6 August 2020|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200411060423/https://people.com/movies/florence-pugh-zach-braff-relationship-timeline/|archive-date=11 April 2020}}</ref>

From 2013 to 2016, Pugh performed [[cover songs]] under the name Flossie Rose on YouTube.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Alter |first1=Rebecca |date=9 January 2020 |title=Before There Was Florence Pugh, There Was Acoustic YouTube Teen Flossie Rose |url=https://www.vulture.com/2020/01/watch-florence-pughs-musical-youtube-teen-alter-ego.html |url-access=limited |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201231183858/https://www.vulture.com/2020/01/watch-florence-pughs-musical-youtube-teen-alter-ego.html |archive-date=31 December 2020 |access-date=9 May 2021 |website=[[Vulture (magazine)|Vulture]]}}</ref> She was featured on her brother's song "Midnight", released on 15 May 2021.<ref name="BBC-20210515">{{cite web |date=15 May 2021 |title=Florence Pugh and Toby Sebastian team up on new single |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-oxfordshire-57085214 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210515203517/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-oxfordshire-57085214 |archive-date=15 May 2021 |access-date=31 May 2021 |publisher=[[BBC News]]}}</ref> In 2020, she participated in the series ''[[Acting for a Cause]]'' for a live reading of [[Kenneth Lonergan]]'s play ''[[This Is Our Youth]]'' to help raise funds for the [[Entertainment Industry Foundation]], a nonprofit organisation, during the [[COVID-19 pandemic]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=George |first=Doug |date=13 May 2020 |title=Oak Parker stages Zoom plays as COVID-19 benefits, casting Florence Pugh and more young Hollywood actors |url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/coronavirus/ct-ent-hollywood-actors-play-readings-0509-20200508-uvu2aozegzepndqwrrl5tdljxq-story.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201204155423/https://www.chicagotribune.com/coronavirus/ct-ent-hollywood-actors-play-readings-0509-20200508-uvu2aozegzepndqwrrl5tdljxq-story.html |archive-date=4 December 2020 |access-date=18 September 2020 |work=[[Chicago Tribune]]}}</ref>

==Accolades==
{{Main|List of awards and nominations received by Florence Pugh}}
Pugh has been nominated for an [[Academy Award]] and two [[British Academy Film Awards]].<ref name="women"/><ref>{{cite web|last1=Rosseinsky|first1=Katie|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/florence-pugh-roles-lady-macbeth-little-drummer-girl-a4337246.html|title=7 Florence Pugh performances you need to see – and where to watch them|work=[[Evening Standard]]|date=18 January 2020|access-date=9 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200530150707/https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/florence-pugh-roles-lady-macbeth-little-drummer-girl-a4337246.html|archive-date=30 May 2020|url-status=live}}</ref> She received an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actress and a BAFTA Award nomination for Best Actress in a Supporting Role, both for her work in ''Little Women'', as well as a BAFTA Rising Star Award nomination. Her performances in ''Lady Macbeth'' and ''The Wonder'' respectively earned her a [[British Independent Film Award]] win and another nomination.<ref name="BIFA"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2022/11/british-independent-film-awards-aftersun-blue-jean-lead-nominations-1235163320/|title=British Independent Film Awards: 'Aftersun,' 'Blue Jean' & 'The Wonder' Lead Nominations|website=Deadline Hollywood|first=Zac|last=Ntim|date=4 November 2022|accessdate=4 November 2022|archive-date=4 November 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221104140656/https://deadline.com/2022/11/british-independent-film-awards-aftersun-blue-jean-lead-nominations-1235163320/|url-status=live}}</ref> At the [[2019 Cannes Film Festival]], Pugh was awarded the [[Trophée Chopard]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2019/film/global/cannes-chopard-awards-florence-pugh-francois-civil-1203222082/|title=Florence Pugh, Francois Civil Honored With Chopard Award for Rising Talent|last=Keslassy|first=Elsa|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=21 March 2019|access-date=28 August 2020|archive-date=22 May 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190522211543/https://variety.com/2019/film/global/cannes-chopard-awards-florence-pugh-francois-civil-1203222082/|url-status=live}}</ref>
